lessonSubtitleText: Test how well you know this story

questions.text: What did God tell Moses to do?
answers: Choose twelve men to spy out the Promised Land
Build a second tabernacle
Pick a man to be king
Lead the people back to Egypt

questions.text: What instructions did Moses give the spies?
answers: See what the land was like — its food, towns, and people
Count every tree in the Promised Land
Warn the people that we're coming
Find a place to build a palace

questions.text: How long were the spies in the Promised Land?
answers: 40 days
40 weeks
12 days
1 year

questions.text: What did the spies say to Moses about the land they saw?
answers: It was flowing with milk and honey
It was empty with no food
It was covered in snow
It was all desert sand

questions.text: What did the ten spies say to the people?
answers: We can’t defeat those people — we’re like grasshoppers to them
We can win easily without God’s help
The land is too far away to reach
The people there want to be our friends

questions.text: When the people wanted to go back to Egypt, what did Caleb say?
answers: God will give us this land
Let’s build a ship and sail away
We should hide in the mountains
You're right; let's go back to Egypt!

questions.text: After Caleb spoke up, what did the people talk about doing?
answers: Killing Joshua and Caleb
Making Caleb the new leader
Throwing a big celebration
Building a wall around the camp

questions.text: What happened when the people tried to kill Joshua and Caleb?
answers: God’s glory appeared at the Tabernacle
A giant storm scattered the camp
The spies ran away and hid
God sent a violent earthquake

questions.text: When God said He would destroy the people, what did Moses ask?
answers: Please forgive them
Please give them more manna
Please send them to a different land
Please choose a new leader instead

questions.text: What consequence did God give His people?
answers: They would wander in the desert for 40 years
They would build a new city in Egypt
They would never eat bread again
They would immediately enter the land with no trouble
